name: Gingerbread House
steps: Cream shortening and sugar. Blend in molasses, water, flour, salt, soda and spices. Divide dough into fourths and wrap in plastic wrap. Refrigerate overnight or for several hours until cool. Roll dough on floured board, turning to prevent sticking, 1/8' and 1/4' thick. Cut into several pieces.

Combine scraps and roll again to complete house. Save additional scraps to make an optional 5th house. One house should be cut from each ball. One house should be cooked on one cookie sheet. Bake at 375 F on parchment paper sprayed wax paper.

Bake for 10-12 minutes. House pieces need to be baked until light brown, but hard. Can cut for accuracy while still warm. Allow to cool several minutes on baking sheet, then transfer to cooling rack. Allow to dry and harden for several days.
